reasoning: Primary mitochondrial disorders estimated at ~1-2 per 100k live births (incidence) with population prevalence of 10-15 per 100k. Using midpoint estimates. Moderate confidence due to non-specific umbrella nature and variability in clinical diagnostic criteria across studies.
source: Schaefer AM et al. (2008). The epidemiology of mitochondrial disorders. Am J Hum Genet. 76(6):909-920
